intro: Odina cuneifoliolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf odina, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the wet season. Odina cuneifoliolata is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests.
